org.bbi.linuxjoy

Class LinuxJoystickEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bbi.linuxjoy.LinuxJoystickEvent

  • public class LinuxJoystickEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    The Linux joystick event structure. Refer to the kernel's joystick API for data structure details in the kernel directory: Documentation/input/joystick-api.txt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int AXIS 
      static int BUTTON 
      static java.nio.ByteOrder ENDIANNESS
      Byte order for raw data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LinuxJoystickEvent(byte[] ibuf)
      The constructor will decode and populate the fields of the joystick event

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static byte[] constructPacket(int timestamp, short value, byte type, byte num)
      An utility function that can be used to construct an 8-byte Linux joystick event packet given the field values
      byte getNum()
      Get event number.
      byte[] getRaw()
      Get raw data stream
      int getTimestamp()
      Get kernel timestamp of this event
      byte getType()
      Get event type, see kernel documentation for details.
      int getValue()
      Get 2-byte value from the event, could be a button press (1 or 0) or an axis value (-32767 to 32767)

    • Field Detail

      • ENDIANNESS

        public static java.nio.ByteOrder ENDIANNESS
        Byte order for raw data. Uses the native byte order the JVM is running on as default

      • BUTTON

        public static final int BUTTON
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int AXIS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinuxJoystickEvent

        public LinuxJoystickEvent(byte[] ibuf)
        The constructor will decode and populate the fields of the joystick event
        Parameters:
        ibuf - the 8-byte data

    • Method Detail

      • getRaw

        public byte[] getRaw()
        Get raw data stream
        Returns:
        8-byte Linux joystick event data as a byte array

      • getTimestamp

        public int getTimestamp()
        Get kernel timestamp of this event
        Returns:
        Timestamp as int in milliseconds

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Get 2-byte value from the event, could be a button press (1 or 0) or an axis value (-32767 to 32767)
        Returns:
        Integer ranging from -32767 to 32767

      • getType

        public byte getType()
        Get event type, see kernel documentation for details. In short, 0x1 is a button event and 0x2 is an axis event
        Returns:
        1-byte value denoting the type of event

      • getNum

        public byte getNum()
        Get event number. This could be the number of the button as provided by the driver or the axis number. Note that a "stick" input can have two axes.
        Returns:
        1-byte value denoting the event number

      • isButtonDown

        public int isButtonDown()
        Check if this event corresponds to a pressed button
        Returns:
        The numerical ID of the pressed button or -1 if it is not a button press event

      • isButtonUp

        public int isButtonUp()
        Check if this event corresponds to a released button
        Returns:
        The numerical ID of the released button, or -1 if it is not a button release event

      • isAxisChanged

        public int isAxisChanged()
        Check if this event corresponds to a change in an axis
        Returns:
        The numerical ID of the changed axis, or -1 if it is not an axis change event

      • constructPacket

        public static byte[] constructPacket(int timestamp,
                     short value,
                     byte type,
                     byte num)
        An utility function that can be used to construct an 8-byte Linux joystick event packet given the field values
        Parameters:
        timestamp - 4-byte timestamp value
        value - 2-byte event value (axis value or button state)
        type - 1-byte event type
        num - 1-byte event number (axis or button numerical ID)
        Returns:
        packed 8-byte serial data

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
